115 - 16 Jan 2024 06:49PM - +263 77 898 6737: EWYL Projects  Question 1 :Name all three projects.  1.CORPORATE ALLIANCES. 2.COMMUNITY BUILDING. 3.AFRICAN SCHOOLS EDUCATION REFORM MISSION.  Question 2: What do you understand from project 1?  Primary outcome: Edoofians will represent Edoofa to build a network of partner companies and potential employers. This will help Edoofian to  create a strong professional network and earn scholarship credits. -Skillset(s) covered: Networking skills, Using professional networking websites like LinkedIn, building confidence, good communication skills and use of Google sheets -Mindset(s) covered: Reaching out to people who are influential,try again,fail facing rejections, fail, try again, never give up attitude. DESCRIPTIONS AND GUIDELINES FOR STUDENTS Identify local Organizations/ Companies in their countries and regions. Identify the decision-makers who work in these Companies. Reaching out to these Individuals to share Edoofa‚Äôs vision, mission and the work we do. Arranging for a call/video call meeting between Edoofa and these Organizations. Finally facilitating the signing of Contract.  Activity 1:A By finding them on internet Edoofians can search for companies which: 1.Provide mobile applications or are a  finance technology. 2.Deal in payment systems and mobile wallets. Have community-driveplatforms. 3Deal in Students based products and services. Which are Education technology companies. 4.Research about each company to understand : How many employees are working in the organization? 5.What is the yearly revenue of the company? Edoofa need organizations which have-More than 25-30 employees, Minimum annual turnover of 1.5 million dollars, Once Edoofian  have identified, and created this list he or she will have successfully completed  first activity.  Activity 2: -Identify the decision-makers who work these Organizations and reach out to them.. Edofians  can also reach these people through their own connections .  Activity3: Sharing Edoofa's message with your connections.  Activity 4 : Arranging for a meeting or video call with Edoofa and Signing the contract.  In this activity once professional you're working with agrees with  seniors in team Edoofa to get a professional contract,Prepare the signing of a contract, an email contract. There will be a  follow-up involved in many different stages, but it is how deals happen.  Activity5: Reporting through the entire activity.  Project Milestones Worth of Scholarship credits Call with Edoofa Managers $2 per call Signing of the MoU $20 Giving internship/job opportunities to $10 the students of Edoofa in future proposal. All this information above are the Scholarship credits Edoofian can get.  Question 2:What do you understand from project 2?  Answer:CORPORATE ALLIANCES.  Community building is a field of practices directed toward the creation or enhancement of community among individuals within a regional area with a interest.  There is primary outcome under this project whereby students will reach out to their personal network and offer other people an opportunity to be part of Edoofa . -Skillset(s) covered: Networking skills, Persuasion skills,  social media. Mindset(s) covered: Identifying an opportunity and to be enthusiastic about it. Further sharing such opportunities openly to create the impactin the lives of other people.  There are Guidelines and directions for Students.  Under this project students are expected to wear the hat of a super networker and a person who has amazing persuasion skills. Students will understand the most critical aspect development organization which based on creating social impact. You will  become the part of team Edoofa and help this ecosystem grow.We will work with you through different stages to ensure success in this project.  Activity 1 under project 2:Filling Application forms:  - Create the  list of all the youth who are part of your close and extended network,it can be your  your friends, relatives or friends on social media. -The youth must have graduated from their senior secondary schools either recently or in the last six months.  Activity 2: Reaching-out and Sharing about Edoofa Instructional details. -Then there is  creation of a strategy to reach out to the  entire network.- and decide on numbers of follow-ups that Edoofa will do and will strongly pursue all the leads. All of the work  acquire the most essential and one of the highly paid Business development skills.A part from these benefits you will also get Scholarship Credits mentioned below. -Incentive Payouts related to Project - 3 Every student that gets  enrols into the Edoofa Program and pays the first part of the enrolment fee, you will be getting $20 worth of Scholarship credits. During  Admission Formalities of the university, Edoofians will be getting $30 worth of Scholarship credits There is an additional opportunity to earn $5 worth of Scholarship credits per students  that Edoofa team connect with you for clarity on the program   Question 4 :What do you understand from project 3?  AFRICAN SCHOOLS EDUCATION REFORM MISSION:Primary outcome: Students will reach out to Local Schools in their local region and will speak to the decision makers to collaborate with Edoofa. And this Project is only for Senior Secondary Schools It will be a non commercial tie-up with the agenda of offering help to Senior Secondary Schools. Edoofa has taken a mission to help African Schools to grow. Guidelines for students: Under this project students will reach out to severals schools in their region and help:1.Training teacher. 2.Collaboration and Tie-Ups between top Indian schools with the African counterparts. 3.Career Counselling and sharing courses. 69 - 16 Jan 2024 11:02AM - Garima Edoofa: *Bachelor in Physiotherapy* is a branch of healthcare that applies modes of physical movement such as exercise, massage, besides education, advice, and counselling services to circumstances where movement and function are threatened by ageing, pain, injury, diseases, disorders, conditions, or other environmental factors.  Students enrolled to the course are taught on an advanced level about core physiotherapeutic skills such as manual therapy, therapeutic exercises, and application of electro-physical modalities, which have been proven to cure a range of disabilities and disease related to spine, back, neck, and even stress-related incontinence.  Bachelor of Physiotherapy is a 4-year undergraduate course, including compulsory 6 months of clinical internship, and involving the science of physical movement aimed at preventing disease and disability.  The opportunities for a career in Physiotherapy are excellent, whether in the public health system, private practice or non-government organisations. Career pathways include the disciplines and areas of:  *Healthcare Management* *Industrial Rehabilitation* *Research & Academics* *Special Schools* *Multinational companies for fitness of their employers*

57 - 16 Jan 2024 01:35PM - Garima Edoofa: A *B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology* is a 3-year undergraduate program that focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in the field of clinical laboratory science. Medical laboratory technologists play a crucial role in the healthcare system by conducting various laboratory tests and analyses that assist in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.  During the program, students are trained in various laboratory techniques, sample collection, testing procedures, and result interpretation. They learn how to handle and analyze different types of biological samples, such as blood, urine, tissue, and body fluids. *The curriculum also includes theoretical and practical courses in subjects like microbiology, biochemistry, hematology, immunology, and pathology.*  *Upon completion of the program, graduates can pursue careers as Laboratory Technicians, Laboratory Managers, Medical Officers, Research Associates, Medical Record Technicians, Resident Medical Officers, Lab Assistants, Laboratory Testing Managers, or even pursue teaching positions as Associate Professors or Lecturers in the field of medical laboratory science.*  Job opportunities for medical laboratory technologists can be found in a variety of settings, including hospitals, healthcare clinics, medical pathology laboratories, research laboratories, urologists' offices, and other healthcare facilities. They work closely with healthcare professionals, such as doctors and pathologists, to provide accurate and timely laboratory test results that contribute to patient care and treatment decisions.  *Overall, a B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology provides graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform laboratory tests, contribute to medical research, and make a valuable impact in the field of healthcare.*

66 - 16 Jan 2024 09:49AM - Gurvinder: A *B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology* is a 3-year undergraduate program that focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in the field of clinical laboratory science. Medical laboratory technologists play a crucial role in the healthcare system by conducting various laboratory tests and analyses that assist in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.  During the program, students are trained in various laboratory techniques, sample collection, testing procedures, and result interpretation. They learn how to handle and analyze different types of biological samples, such as blood, urine, tissue, and body fluids. *The curriculum also includes theoretical and practical courses in subjects like microbiology, biochemistry, hematology, immunology, and pathology.*  *Upon completion of the program, graduates can pursue careers as Laboratory Technicians, Laboratory Managers, Medical Officers, Research Associates, Medical Record Technicians, Resident Medical Officers, Lab Assistants, Laboratory Testing Managers, or even pursue teaching positions as Associate Professors or Lecturers in the field of medical laboratory science.*  Job opportunities for medical laboratory technologists can be found in a variety of settings, including hospitals, healthcare clinics, medical pathology laboratories, research laboratories, urologists' offices, and other healthcare facilities. They work closely with healthcare professionals, such as doctors and pathologists, to provide accurate and timely laboratory test results that contribute to patient care and treatment decisions.  *Overall, a B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology provides graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform laboratory tests, contribute to medical research, and make a valuable impact in the field of healthcare.*

121 - 16 Jan 2024 02:08PM - Gurvinder: The cost of tertiary education in India is much lower than in Western countries. In contrast, tuition fees for higher education in the UK, for example, can range from *USD 15000 to USD 35000*. Meanwhile, the US tuition cost is much higher, with the average cost of a 4-year degree ranging from *USD 80,000 to over USD 250,000.*

70 - 16 Jan 2024 03:58PM - +263 78 942 9086: BA stands for
71 - 16 Jan 2024 04:00PM - Gurvinder: *Bachelor of Arts in Geography* is 3- year an undergraduate course divided into 6 semesters. It involves the study of the earth and its lands, features, inhabitants, and phenomena.  The course curriculum explores not only the geographical features of the earth but also its features and population. It is one of the specializations of Bachelor of Arts (BA) that deals in various areas such as the study of the features of soil, climate, and plantations are covered in the course besides the geography of the world as a whole.  Students enrolled to the course are taken to annual field trips to observe and analyse field data for stimulating awareness of the environment. They are also trained on cartography and report writing through presentations on thematic atlases and field reports. Upon successful completion of the course, graduates are lucratively hired both in private and public sectors, in colleges, universities, NGOs, among others.
72 - 16 Jan 2024 04:00PM - Gurvinder: *What is it About?*  BA in Geography is a 3- year course, minimum eligibility for which is an intermediate qualification in any discipline. Geography is the study of the earth, including aspects such as land, topography, attributes, people and phenomena. Subjects covered in the discipline are Environment and Ecology, Fundamentals of Remote Sensing and GIS, Statistical Techniques, Spatial Analysis, Advanced Physical Geography, Contemporary Human Geography, Computer Aided Mapping, Thematic Atlas, Spatial Economic Systems, Natural Resource Management, Political Geography, Agricultural Geography, Social Geography of India, Urban Settlement System, Regional Development, Cultural Geography, Hydrology and Water Resource Management, Environmental Impact Assessment, Geography of Landscape, Demography and Population Policy, Health, Environment and Society, among others.
73 - 16 Jan 2024 04:00PM - Gurvinder: *Who Should Opt?*  Students with the capability of and interest in analysis, problem-solving, decision-making, critically interpreting data and text, developing reasoned arguments, numerical skills, team-work, planning skills, presenting oral and written arguments and information, communication and technology, are best suited for the course.  *Career Prospects*  Successful graduates of the course are professionally recruited as Urban and Regional Planners, Remote Sensing Specialists, Researchers etc.  They are also hired in research agencies meant for environmental issues, population studies and rural development, in the teaching profession at universities, colleges, schools and coaching institutes.  Fieldwork is an essential part of the curriculum, aimed at developing students‚Äô practical skills, hands-on experience, useful in fields like commerce, transport and tourism, business, law and finance sectors.  Successful graduates of the course are hired in fields such as:  *Agriculture Research* *GIS and Remote Sensing* *Colleges and University* *Environment Protection Agencies* *Gas Exploration Companies* *Government Research Institutes* *Mining Industry* *NGOs*

209 - 16 Jan 2024 12:54PM - Gurvinder: Mr Emmanuel, The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on student‚Äôs performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing ‚Äì just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics.  Promising a better future for its students, and converting an Individual into a Market Ready Professional. Who would have every weapon in their arsenal to conquer the place they shall be landing their foot in.
210 - 16 Jan 2024 12:54PM - Gurvinder: If I have to help you explain properly how the Earn While You Learn Program helps a student, let us take an example wherein we assume the annual fee to be $2200 a year. Now if you manage to earn scholarship credits worth *$100 in a month, this means that you can earn $1200 in a year*, and that would basically bring the cost further down to *$1000 per year which includes the cost of tuition, food and accommodation*, which means for the family monthly cost of the student‚Äôs education would be somewhere between $90-$100 a month.  _*NOTE:- This does not mean that there is any limit up to which a student can earn scholarship credits. In short as much as a student is willing to work hard to sponsor his higher education, he/she can earn accordingly.*_

162 - 16 Jan 2024 11:17AM - Kunal: Let me tell you how Edoofa helps Edoofians bring down the fees themselves and make them affordable. It is through the *Earn While You Learn Program*  The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn scholarship credits (based on student‚Äôs performance) that are equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable. The Earn While You Learn Program helps the students to learn and develop the skills necessary for the digital workspace environment- which namely include Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing ‚Äì just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies and needs, converting an Individual into a market-ready professional. So, here are a few examples and accomplishments of the EWYL Program, which Edoofa only focuses on increasing and broadening.
163 - 16 Jan 2024 11:17AM - Kunal: *Projects with Brands and Companies: -* The EWYL Program has been recognized and appreciated by a lot of market leaders, such as: *Africa Global Radio-* The company joined hands with Edoofa, to provide students exposure to the Digital world and the skills used to create a stronghold in the market. These opportunities have been exclusively created for our Edoofians to get placed and start their professional journey in the sectors and fields they have already worked and have experienced through the EWYL Program. Some of the brands that are always eager to hire an Edoofian are:- Nigenuis Skooqs Success Magazine TIA Organics  *Webinars:-* We understand the importance of learning through the experience of others, and hence the EWYL Program also conducts webinars regularly with the current leaders in the business field. 279 - 16 Jan 2024 10:29AM - Sahil Edoofa: I understand what you are sharing, basically, my motive behind asking such a question was the fact that, as a counsellor, I have helped tens of thousands of students in the last 5 and a half years in Zimbabwe, and I do understand that financial stability in an economy like Zimbabwe is quite difficult these days. This is why I want to ask you if your child manages to pass the eligibility check stage, then you would have to complete payment of $350 towards the enrollment fee.  I feel in Zimbabwe, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zimbabwe has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zimbabwean families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.

I feel in Zimbabwe, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zimbabwe has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zimbabwean families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.

107 - 16 Jan 2024 01:36PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: BA Geography  *Bachelor of Arts in Geography* is 3- year an undergraduate course divided into 6 semesters. It involves the study of the earth and its lands, features, inhabitants, and phenomena.  The course curriculum explores not only the geographical features of the earth but also its features and population. It is one of the specializations of Bachelor of Arts (BA) that deals in various areas such as the study of the features of soil, climate, and plantations are covered in the course besides the geography of the world as a whole.  Students enrolled to the course are taken to annual field trips to observe and analyse field data for stimulating awareness of the environment. They are also trained on cartography and report writing through presentations on thematic atlases and field reports. Upon successful completion of the course, graduates are lucratively hired both in private and public sectors, in colleges, universities, NGOs, among others.  *What is it About?*  BA in Geography is a 3- year course, minimum eligibility for which is an intermediate qualification in any discipline. Geography is the study of the earth, including aspects such as land, topography, attributes, people and phenomena. Subjects covered in the discipline are Environment and Ecology, Fundamentals of Remote Sensing and GIS, Statistical Techniques, Spatial Analysis, Advanced Physical Geography, Contemporary Human Geography, Computer Aided Mapping, Thematic Atlas, Spatial Economic Systems, Natural Resource Management, Political Geography, Agricultural Geography, Social Geography of India, Urban Settlement System, Regional Development, Cultural Geography, Hydrology and Water Resource Management, Environmental Impact Assessment, Geography of Landscape, Demography and Population Policy, Health, Environment and Society, among others.  *Who Should Opt?*  Students with the capability of and interest in analysis, problem-solving, decision-making, critically interpreting data and text, developing reasoned arguments, numerical skills, team-work, planning skills, presenting oral and written arguments and information, communication and technology, are best suited for the course.  *Career Prospects*  Successful graduates of the course are professionally recruited as Urban and Regional Planners, Remote Sensing Specialists, Researchers etc.  They are also hired in research agencies meant for environmental issues, population studies and rural development, in the teaching profession at universities, colleges, schools and coaching institutes.  Fieldwork is an essential part of the curriculum, aimed at developing students‚Äô practical skills, hands-on experience, useful in fields like commerce, transport and tourism, business, law and finance sectors.  Successful graduates of the course are hired in fields such as:  *Agriculture Research* *GIS and Remote Sensing* *Colleges and University* *Environment Protection Agencies* *Gas Exploration Companies* *Government Research Institutes* *Mining Industry* *NGOs*   *Agriculture Specialist* Agriculture Specialists often specialize in specific area, for example, animal science, economics, agricultural mechanics, soil science, or field crops. They work closely with farmers and livestock producers to ensure the business‚Äô success  *Geographer* Geographers study the earth and its land, features, and inhabitants. They also examine political or cultural elements related to geography.  *Cartographer* A Cartographer is involved with the scientific, technological and artistic aspects of developing and producing maps. They present complex information as diagrams, charts and spreadsheets, as well as in the form of conventional maps  *Demographer* A demographer, or Demographic Analyst, is a social scientist who uses statistical methods to study the size, distribution and structure of human populations.  *Forest Manager* Forest/ Woodland Managers, or Foresters, are responsible for managing forests and woodlands and overseeing activities such as timber production, conservation and recreation. They maintain and manage various issues associated with woodland areas, such as commercial interests, biodiversity and public access.

Medical Laboratory Technology  A *B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology* is a 3-year undergraduate program that focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in the field of clinical laboratory science. Medical laboratory technologists play a crucial role in the healthcare system by conducting various laboratory tests and analyses that assist in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.  During the program, students are trained in various laboratory techniques, sample collection, testing procedures, and result interpretation. They learn how to handle and analyze different types of biological samples, such as blood, urine, tissue, and body fluids. *The curriculum also includes theoretical and practical courses in subjects like microbiology, biochemistry, hematology, immunology, and pathology.*  *Upon completion of the program, graduates can pursue careers as Laboratory Technicians, Laboratory Managers, Medical Officers, Research Associates, Medical Record Technicians, Resident Medical Officers, Lab Assistants, Laboratory Testing Managers, or even pursue teaching positions as Associate Professors or Lecturers in the field of medical laboratory science.*  Job opportunities for medical laboratory technologists can be found in a variety of settings, including hospitals, healthcare clinics, medical pathology laboratories, research laboratories, urologists' offices, and other healthcare facilities. They work closely with healthcare professionals, such as doctors and pathologists, to provide accurate and timely laboratory test results that contribute to patient care and treatment decisions.  *Overall, a B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology provides graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform laboratory tests, contribute to medical research, and make a valuable impact in the field of healthcare.*

Research and Innovation: Indian researchers and scientists actively contribute to medical research. Affordable Healthcare Services: India is known for providing cost-effective healthcare services, making medical treatments more accessible to a broader population. Pharmaceutical Industry: India has a robust pharmaceutical industry and is a major producer of generic medicines. Diversity in Medical Conditions: India's diverse population and varied environmental conditions provide a unique setting for studying a wide range of medical conditions. Global Collaborations: Indian medical institutions and professionals actively collaborate with international counterparts, fostering knowledge exchange and advancements in medical science.
